entry.title: Debate: 64 bytes in OP_RETURN VS taproot OP_FALSE OP_IF OP_PUSH
entry.summary: Christopher Allen inquired about the most efficient method to place 64-bytes into the Bitcoin blockchain for a particular protocol such as a timestamp or a commitment. He asked whether a traditional OP_RETURN or a spent taproot transaction is better, given the anti-OP_RETURN sentiment. He also sought to know if there was a safer way to store 64 bytes without clogging up UTXO space, only spent transaction `-txindex` space. Christopher believed that the taproot method is superior, but he wanted to hear all sides of the issue.
